A thoroughly uninteresting dustbowl from which the ferry leaves for Havelock.  The only beach nearby was unfortunately washed away by the tsunami and all that remains is stones.  Apart from that the only thing to keep you here is the transport connections.
There is a bus service (210 Kms.) from
A ferry runs Rangat to Long Island to Havelock to Neil to Port Blair daily except Saturday.  The jetty is quite a way from town, take a autorickshaw (50Rs)

Panchavati water fall and beach Amkunj beach Betapur beach Cutbert Bay Beach (20 kms.) away from Rangat bazaar/jetty) is a turtle nesting ground (December to February). 

Government owned Guest house Hawksbill Nest is near to the Cutbert bay beach and Turtle sanctuary

value: address=Teja International Complex, near new STS Terminus
content=Fresh food with different varieties of Bengali, Indian and Chinese foods.

There are a couple of bars near the UK Nest guesthouse.

value: address=Near Co-op printing press, Dasarathpur & Church Road, Rangat
directions=About a five minute walk away from the old bus station; a new one's being built another 5 minutes walk away.
content=Slightly grubby rooms with tiny en-suite bathrooms & cable TV.  Room service available.  Good if you're stuck for a night in Rangat.
directions=About 15 minutes bus journey north of Rangat, on the way to the jetty
price=Dorm 150Rs p/p; double 600 Rs, a\c double 1000 Rs.
content=On a beach north of town where Hawksbill turtles nest in season. To book contact
